{"step_by_step_thinking": "The vertebral column consists of several parts: cervical, thoracic, lumbar, sacral, and coccygeal vertebrae. According to the documents, there are 7 cervical, 12 thoracic, 5 lumbar, 5 sacral (which fuse into one bone in adults), and 4 coccygeal (which can also fuse into one bone). So, if we count the sacrum and coccyx as one bone each, the total number of vertebrae in an adult human is 26.", "answer_choice": "B. 34"}
